thread.section_title: Business News, Economy, Finance & ASX Market News
thread.title: Jack Dorsey gives a third of his Twitter stock back to employees
thread.title_full: Jack Dorsey gives a third of his Twitter stock back to employees

author: Sarah Frier
title: Jack Dorsey gives a third of his Twitter stock back to employees
text:
'I'm Square CEO': Dorsey's prior commitments make him an unlikely choice for Twitter's next honcho. Photo: Bloomberg
Twitter Inc chief executive Jack Dorsey is giving a third of his Twitter stock to the company's employees, he said in a tweet on Friday.
The shares amount to 1 per cent of the San Francisco-based company, worth about $US200 million.
I'd rather have a smaller part of something big than a bigger part of something small.
Jack Dorsey The move is to "reinvest directly in our people," he said. It will go into the employee equity pool.
"I'd rather have a smaller part of something big than a bigger part of something small," Mr Dorsey tweeted.
Advertisement "I'm confident we can make Twitter big!"
I'm giving ~1/3rd of my Twitter stock (exactly 1% of the company) to our employee equity pool to reinvest directly in our people.
— Jack (@jack) October 23, 2015
As for me: I'd rather have a smaller part of something big than a bigger part of something small. I'm confident we can make Twitter big!
— Jack (@jack) October 23, 2015 His decision to give away shares may increase employee morale after recent staff cuts and help Twitter expand the pool of stock used to compensate employees without dilution.
In the two weeks since he officially took the top job, Mr Dorsey has made some big moves.
The CEO cut 8 per cent of Twitter's workforce, appointed a new executive chairman, introduced the new Moments product and held a developer conference.
Mr Dorsey owns a bigger share of Square Inc, the payments company where he is also CEO, which is currently preparing for an initial public offering.
Of his 24.4 per cent in Square, Mr Dorsey is giving a large portion to an organisation he created. The Start Small Foundation will invest in artists, musicians and local businesses in underserved communities, according to Square's prospectus.
Twitter will announce third-quarter earnings on October 27.
Bloomberg
